titleStmt.title: Florida A and M University - Letter of Reply
titleStmt.author: Unknown Author

publicationStmt.p: This document forms part of the project "Editing the Eartha M.M. White Archive" at the University of North Florida.

msIdentifier.repository: University of North Florida, Thomas G. Carpenter Library Special Collections and Archives

objectDesc.p: This document is a one-page, printed paper letter, sent by an official at Florida A and M University and addressed to Eartha M. M. White. The letter contains a short description of Thomas Van Gibbs, a former vice president at the university.

editorialDecl.p: This file was transcribed and encoded according to the editorial criteria of the project "Editing the Eartha M.M. White Archive." Using the various options encoded within <choice> elements, this file enables the viewing of a diplomatic transcription and a regularized reading text.

div.head:
Florida A and M University
Tallahassee, Florida
May 3, 1954

div.p:
Miss Eartha M. M. White
615 West Ashley Street
Jacksonville, Florida

Enclosed is the photograph that you have long since asked for.
Please excuse the delay in sending it to you sooner.

Thomas Van Gibbs, Vice-President, 1887 - 1900, was educated at
Oberlin and West Point Military Academy. As a member of the
Florida Legislature, he introduced the bill that provided for the
establishment of Florida A and M College. He was appointed Vice-
President by A. J. Russell, Superintendent of Public Instruction.

If we can be of further assistance to you please do not
hesitate to write.

body.closer:
Yours truly,
J. Henderson
Head--Business Education and
Administration
JVA/dmj
Enclosure
